justification: It notes B’s conservatism and injury aversion but misreads priorities. B trusts consensus and values healthy workhorse RBs; trading a Tier 1 RB (Xavier) for an out RB (Lopez) plus a marginal TE upgrade is implausible. B already has a healthy TE (Cameron Baker), so Turner isn’t a meaningful incentive. The offer is lopsided and the 0.64 accept probability is unrealistic. Rationale is brief and inaccurate (calling the RB swap ‘lateral’).
